oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How the organic retailers cope with the economic downturn
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vaclavik, Tom
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During 2009, the organic market experienced an overall slowdown in growth, but no dramatic decline - Markets hardest hit by economic downturn: UK - Markets, where the organic shops were not doing very well: CZ, HU, Switzerland - Therefore important: Try new concepts: organic+fair, organic+regional, organic to go, shop and eat, organic+glamour
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Vaclavik, Tom (2010) How the organic retailers cope with the economic downturn. Paper at: BioFach Congress, Nürnberg, 17. – 20.02.2010. [Unpublished]
